channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration is restricting the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children’s teeth.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Perrone, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Ramen instead of Reese's? Looming SNAP cuts change what's on offer for Halloween trick-or-treaters
item.description: When KC Neufeld announced on her Denver neighborhood’s Facebook page that her family would be handing out ramen and packs of macaroni and cheese in addition to candy this Halloween, she wasn't expecting much of a response.
item.dc:creator: HALLIE GOLDEN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Drug gang linked to murder of Colombian rapper, DJ
item.description: Mexican authorities are reporting the arrest of 16 people in connection to the murder of two Colombian artists last month.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Wisconsin becomes the 36th state to limit cellphones in schools
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin became the 36th state to limit cellphones and other electronic devices in school Friday, when its Democratic governor signed a bill requiring districts to prohibit phone use during class time.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Scammers targeting owners of lost pets in Indianapolis
item.description: The caller told her they found her cat but that it had been hit by a car and that she needed to pay for surgery to get it back.
item.dc:creator: Charles Benberry, NewsNation

item.title: Death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution after admitting to gruesome murder
item.description: South Carolina death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution for Nov. 14, becoming the third this year to select the method.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump says he’s not considering strikes within Venezuela
item.description: President Trump on Friday said he was not considering strikes within Venezuela following reports his administration had identified potential military targets within the country.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: US Marine arrested, accused of traveling 'to meet, kidnap and sexually assault' 12-year-old girl: FBI
item.description: Active-duty Marine William Richard Roy arrested by FBI for allegedly traveling from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and assault a 12-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Melodee Buzzard disappearance: FBI, detectives execute search warrants as 'at-risk' 9-year-old remains missing
item.description: The Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office and the FBI conduct multiple search warrants as Melodee Buzzard, a nine-year-old California girl, remains missing.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Ohio OKs new map giving GOP an edge in 2 districts
item.description: The map was created without public input in a unanimous vote from the Ohio Redistricting Commission and will remain in place until 2030.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Coast Guard stops panga with 11 Mexican migrants near San Diego
item.description: The Coast Guard frequently patrols the waters off Southern California to deter and respond to maritime smuggling attempts.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, NewsNation

item.title: What does SNAP stand for? Food assistance program set to be disrupted by government shutdown
item.description: (KRON) -- With the government shutdown that began on Oct. 1 about to enter its second month, dozens of government programs are already being impacted with further disruptions on the horizon.
item.dc:creator: Alex Baker, KRON4

item.title: Last-minute scramble over pay takes a toll on military families during the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The government shutdown is exacting a heavy mental toll on the nation's military families, leaving them not knowing from week to week whether their paychecks will arrive.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Blue city perp with 50+ arrests accused of pushing stranger onto train tracks in fifth attack that day: report
item.description: Repeat offender with over 50 prior arrests goes on alleged violent crime spree targeting Asian victims across Manhattan, including subway platform assault.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 70 years after the first sabotage of a US airliner, the 44 killed are finally being honored
item.description: LONGMONT, Colo. (AP) — The windows shook as dynamite aboard an airplane exploded over Conrad Hopp's family farm in northern Colorado 70 years ago.
item.dc:creator: COLLEEN SLEVIN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: National Guardsman accused of seeking to send photos of sensitive military technology to Russia
item.description: National Guardsman Canyon Amarys faced federal charges after allegedly trying to send sensitive U.S. military photos and a helicopter radio to Russia.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Investigation continues after hundreds of cremated human remains discovered, recovered from Nevada desert
item.description: More than 315 piles of cremains found scattered across the desert on federal land have been removed by a mortuary as authorities continue to investigate the dumping.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Judge considers demand to force government to keep funding SNAP food aid despite shutdown
item.description: A federal judge in Boston on Thursday challenged the Trump administration's argument that SNAP benefits could be suspended for the first time in the food aid program's history because of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Confirmation hearing for Casey Means, Trump's surgeon general nominee, delayed after she goes into labor
item.description: (The Hill) – The nomination hearing for Casey Means, President Trump’s nominee for surgeon general, in front of the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP) Committee, has been postponed. A spokesperson for the committee, chaired by Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.
item.dc:creator: Max Rego, KRON4

item.title: Funeral home recovers 300+ piles of human remains outside Las Vegas; investigation deepens
item.description: LAS VEGAS (KLAS) -- The federal investigation into who dumped more than 300 piles of human remains in the desert outside Las Vegas continues as a funeral home stepped up Wednesday to recover them.
item.dc:creator: David Charns, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, Fox 5
